docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges were spotty last week. Quiet and generally firm conditions ruled at the outset, or until Thursday afternoon when a nervous undertone was manifest with particular reaction against the pound sterling. On the other hand, the Canadian...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges were spotty last week. Quiet and generally firm conditions ruled at the outset, or until Thursday afternoon when a nervous undertone was manifest with particular reaction against the pound sterling. On the other hand, the Canadian and Swiss currencies turned higher.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Sept. 24, 1948

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges showed a firm undertone and rising scale of values last week. The improvement was not accompanied by volume turnover as the markets were thin, with no special urgency to buy or pressure to sell.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges showed a firm undertone and rising scale of values last week. The improvement was not accompanied by volume turnover as the markets were thin, with no special urgency to buy or pressure to sell.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Oct. 1, 1948

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 (AP) -Federal Judge Oscar Palma Beltran today ordered the arrest of John F. Griffith, former United States cultural attache here, on a charge of having participated in a plot to assassinate President Juan Peron.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 (AP) -Federal Judge Oscar Palma Beltran today ordered the arrest of John F. Griffith, former United States cultural attache here, on a charge of having participated in a plot to assassinate President Juan Peron.
docs.abstract: Judge Palma coercion in union organizing activities; seamen Beltran orders J Griffith, now in Uruguay, held on plot charges; may demand extradition

headline.main: Evita Peron: Portrait Of a First Lady; She is a very real political power in Argenlina -- in fact she is second only to her husband.

docs.snippet: President Truman, in an Executive Order issued last week, set in motion machinery for administration of the Reciprocal Trade Agreements Program under the amended Trade Agreements Act enacted by Congress at its last session.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Truman, in an Executive Order issued last week, set in motion machinery for administration of the Reciprocal Trade Agreements Program under the amended Trade Agreements Act enacted by Congress at its last session.

headline.main: MACHINERY SET UP ON FOREIGN TRADE; Interdepartmental Committee on Agreements Established Under Executive Order

docs.snippet: The sale of two former United States naval frigates, the Knoxville and Pueblo, to the Government of the Dominican Republic was announced yesterday by J. C. Berkwit  Co., 551 Fifth Avenue. The seller had purchased the vessels along with a number of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The sale of two former United States naval frigates, the Knoxville and Pueblo, to the Government of the Dominican Republic was announced yesterday by J. C. Berkwit Co., 551 Fifth Avenue. The seller had purchased the vessels along with a number of other craft from the United States Navy.

headline.main: News of Ships; Dominican Republic Buys Former Navy Freighters, Knoxville, Pueblo

docs.snippet: PARIS, Oct. 15 -- An attempt under the leadership of the Soviet Union to exclude political groups from the protection of the proposed draft convention on genocide was defeated today in the Legal Committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Oct. 15 -- An attempt under the leadership of the Soviet Union to exclude political groups from the protection of the proposed draft convention on genocide was defeated today in the Legal Committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.abstract: UN com defeats USSR-led move to exclude pol groups from protection of proposed draft conv; approves protection of ethnic groups

headline.main: RUSSIA LOSES IN U.N. OVER GENOCIDE DRAFT

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: There was an air of quiet strength in the major foreign currencies last week but a softness ruled in some South Americans. Business was in good volume, considering that Canada recessed on Monday for its Thanksgiving Day holiday, and here observance...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was an air of quiet strength in the major foreign currencies last week but a softness ruled in some South Americans. Business was in good volume, considering that Canada recessed on Monday for its Thanksgiving Day holiday, and here observance of Columbus Day on Tuesday closed the banks and stilled trading interest.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Oct. 15, 1948
